Why is it that we say "midnight" when it's really the beginning of the morning? Is morning part of nighttime?
 
 (Please be aware that I already know the answer.)

post_info.post_title: The night's only half gone when morning begins!

It's three AM. On my shift pattern, that's mid afternoon. 12 noon is bedtime.Night time runs from mid day until dusk.The realities of existence should not be tied to the labels that suit the majority.Time, like a trailer park, is all relative.

I have a friend who's nocturnal. He's a writer and not economically bound by schedules, but does understand general time allocations were derived from hunting, gathering and farming requirements. He just doesn't like them.

Since I retired I am able to set whatever schedule suits me. On most days I am up about 9:00AM and I usually go to bed around 2:00AM. I find the early morning hours are my best time to read or write. I never nap which is funny because when I was working I had problems staying awake during boring afternoon meetings.
 Dono

title: 4Forums.com Political Debates and Polls -  The night's only half gone when morning begins!
